thing-type.label: FGWREU-111 Fibaro Walli Roller Shutter
thing-type.description: Fibaro Walli Roller Shutter<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gtSmart wall switch designed to control motors of roller blinds, awnings, venetian blinds and other single phase, AC powered devices via Z-Wave network.</p&gt <p&gtIt measures active power and energy consumed by the controlled load.</p&gt <p&gtYou can install it with provided cover plate and switch button or other compatible.</p&gt <br /&gt<h2&gtInclusion Information</h2&gt<p&gtZ-Wave device learning mode, allowing to add the device to existing Z-Wave network:</p&gt <ol&gt<li&gtPower the device.</li&gt <li&gtSet the main controller into the adding mode (OH2: search for new things, select Z-Wave binding).</li&gt <li&gtQuickly, three times click one of the buttons.</li&gt <li&gtIf you are adding in Security S2 Authenticated, input the underlined part of the DSK (label on the bottom of the box).</li&gt <li&gtLED will start blinking yellow, wait for the adding process to end.</li&gt <li&gtAdding result will be confirmed by the Z-Wave controller’s message and the LED frame: <ul&gt<li&gt<strong&gtGreen</strong&gt – successful (non-secure, S0, S2 non-authenticated),</li&gt <li&gt<strong&gtMagenta</strong&gt – successful (Security S2 Authenticated),</li&gt <li&gt<strong&gtRed</strong&gt – not successful.</li&gt </ul&gt</li&gt </ol&gt<br /&gt<h2&gtExclusion Information</h2&gt<p&gtZ-Wave device learning mode, allowing to remove the device from existing Z-Wave network. Removing also results in resetting the device to factory defaults:</p&gt <ol&gt<li&gtPower the device.</li&gt <li&gtSet the main controller in remove mode (see the controller's manual).</li&gt <li&gtQuickly, three times click one of the buttons.</li&gt <li&gtLED will start blinking yellow, wait for the removing process to end.</li&gt <li&gtSuccessful removing will be confirmed by the Z-Wave controller’s message and red LED colour.</li&gt </ol&gt

parameter.name: config_11_1
parameter.label: 11: LED frame colour when moving
parameter.description: This parameter defines the LED colour when the motor is running.<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gt0 – LED disabled</p&gt <p&gt1 – White</p&gt <p&gt2 – Red</p&gt <p&gt3 – Green</p&gt <p&gt4 – Blue</p&gt <p&gt5 – Yellow</p&gt <p&gt6 – Cyan</p&gt <p&gt7 – Magenta</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_12_1
parameter.label: 12: LED frame – colour when not moving
parameter.description: This parameter defines the LED colour when the device motor is not running.<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gt0 – LED disabled</p&gt <p&gt1 – White</p&gt <p&gt2 – Red</p&gt <p&gt3 – Green</p&gt <p&gt4 – Blue</p&gt <p&gt5 – Yellow</p&gt <p&gt6 – Cyan</p&gt <p&gt7 – Magenta</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_13_1
parameter.label: 13: LED frame – brightness
parameter.description: This parameter allows to adjust the LED frame brightness.<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gt0 – LED disabled</p&gt <p&gt1-100 (1-100% brightness)</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_24_1
parameter.label: 24: Buttons orientation
parameter.description: This parameter allows reversing the operation of the buttons.<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gt0 – default (1st button UP, 2nd button DOWN)</p&gt <p&gt1 – reversed (1st button DOWN, 2nd button UP)</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_25_1
parameter.label: 25: Outputs orientation
parameter.description: reversing the operation of Q1 and Q2<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter allows reversing the operation of Q1 and Q2 without changing the wiring (e.g. in case of invalid motor connection).</p&gt <p&gt0 - default (Q1 – UP, Q2 – DOWN)</p&gt <p&gt1 - reversed (Q1 – DOWN, Q2 – UP)</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_30_4_0000000F
parameter.label: 30: Alarm configuration - 1st slot
parameter.description: Which alarm frames and how the device should react<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter determines to which alarm frames and how the device should react. The parameters consist of 4 bytes, three most sig-nificant bytes are set according to the official Z-Wave protocol specification.</p&gt <p&gt1B [MSB] – Notification Type</p&gt <p&gt2B – Notification Status</p&gt <p&gt3B – Event/State Parameters</p&gt <p&gt4B [LSB] – action:</p&gt <ul&gt<li&gt0x00 – no action,</li&gt <li&gt0xX1 – open,</li&gt <li&gt0xX2 – close,</li&gt <li&gt0x0X – no action on LED frame,</li&gt <li&gt0x1X – LED frame blinks red,</li&gt <li&gt0x2X – LED frame blinks green,</li&gt <li&gt0x4X – LED frame blinks blue,</li&gt <li&gt0x8X – dis-able LED frame,</li&gt <li&gt0xFX – LED frame LAPD signal (red-white-blue)</li&gt </ul&gt</p&gt

The parameters consist of 4 bytes, three most sig-nificant bytes are set according to the official Z-Wave protocol specification.</p&gt <p&gtdefault: [0x05, 0xFF, 0x00, 0x00](Water Alarm, any notification, no action)</p&gt <p&gt1B [MSB] – Notification Type</p&gt <p&gt2B – Notification Status</p&gt <p&gt3B – Event/State Parameters</p&gt <p&gt4B [LSB] – action:</p&gt <ul&gt<li&gt0x00 – no action,</li&gt <li&gt0xX1 – open,</li&gt <li&gt0xX2 – close,</li&gt <li&gt0x0X – no action on LED frame,</li&gt <li&gt0x1X – LED frame blinks red,</li&gt <li&gt0x2X – LED frame blinks green,</li&gt <li&gt0x4X – LED frame blinks blue,</li&gt <li&gt0x8X – dis-able LED frame,</li&gt <li&gt0xFX – LED frame LAPD signal (red-white-blue)</li&gt </ul&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_35_2
parameter.label: 35: Alarm configuration – duration
parameter.description: duration of alarm sequence<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter defines duration of alarm se-quence. When time set in this parameter elaps-es, alarm is cancelled, LED frame and relay re-store normal operation, but do not recover state from before the alarm.</p&gt <p&gt0 – infinite</p&gt <p&gt1-32400 (1s-9h, 1s step) – duration</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_40_1
parameter.label: 40: First button – scenes sent
parameter.description: which actions result in sending scene IDs<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter determines which actions result in sending scene IDs assigned to them. Values can be combined (e.g. 1+2=3 means that scenes for single and double click are sent).Enabling scenes for triple click disables entering the device in learn mode by triple clicking</p&gt <p&gt0 (no scenes)</p&gt <p&gt1 – Key pressed 1 time</p&gt <p&gt2 – Key pressed 2 times</p&gt <p&gt4 – Key pressed 3 times</p&gt <p&gt8 – Key hold down and key released</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_41_1
parameter.label: 41: Second button – scenes sent
parameter.description: which actions result in sending scene IDs<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter determines which actions result in sending scene IDs assigned to them. Values can be combined (e.g. 1+2=3 means that scenes for single and double click are sent).Enabling scenes for triple click disables entering the device in learn mode by triple clicking.</p&gt <p&gt0 (no scenes)</p&gt <p&gt1 – Key pressed 1 time</p&gt <p&gt2 – Key pressed 2 times</p&gt <p&gt4 – Key pressed 3 times</p&gt <p&gt8 – Key hold down and key released</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_60_1
parameter.label: 60: Power reports – include self-consumption
parameter.description: power measurements include device itself<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtwhether the power measurements should include power consumed by the device itself</p&gt <p&gt0 – self-consumption not included</p&gt <p&gt1 – self-consumption included</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_61_2
parameter.label: 61: Power reports – on change
parameter.description: minimal change in measured power to report<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter defines minimal change (from the last reported) in measured power that re-sults in sending new report. For loads under 50W the parameter is irrelevant, report are sent every 5W change.</p&gt <p&gt0 - reporting on change disabled</p&gt <p&gt1-500 (1-500%, 1% step) – minimal change</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_62_2
parameter.label: 62: Power reports – periodic
parameter.description: reporting interval for measured power<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter defines reporting interval for measured power. Periodic reports are indepen-dent from changes in value (parameter 61).</p&gt <p&gt0 – periodic reports disabled</p&gt <p&gt30-32400 (30s-9h, 1s step) – time interval</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_65_2
parameter.label: 65: Energy reports – on change
parameter.description: minimal change in measured energy to report<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter defines minimal change (from the last reported) in measured energy that re-sults in sending new report.</p&gt <p&gt0 - reporting on change disabled</p&gt <p&gt1-500 (0.01-5kWh, 0.01kWh step) – minimal change</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_66_2
parameter.label: 66: Energy reports – periodic
parameter.description: This reporting interval for measured energy<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter defines reporting interval for measured energy. Periodic reports are indepen-dent from changes in value (parameter 65).</p&gt <p&gt0 – periodic reports disabled</p&gt <p&gt30-32400 (30s-9h, 1s step) – time interval</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_150_1
parameter.label: 150: Force calibration
parameter.description: Set 2 to force device into calibration mode<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtBy setting this parameter to 2 the device enters the calibration mode. The parameter relevant only if the device is set to work in positioning mode (parameter 151 set to 1 or 2).</p&gt <p&gt0 - device is not calibrated</p&gt <p&gt1 - device is calibrated</p&gt <p&gt2 - force device calibration</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_151_1
parameter.label: 151: Operating mode
parameter.description: This parameter allows adjusting operation ac-cording to the connected device.<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gt1 – roller blind (with positioning)</p&gt <p&gt2 – Venetian blind (with positioning)</p&gt <p&gt5 – roller blind with built-in driver</p&gt <p&gt6 – roller blind with built-in driver (impulse)</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_152_4
parameter.label: 152: Venetian blind – time of full turn of the slats
parameter.description: time of full turn cycle of the slats<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtFor Venetian blinds (parameter 151 set to 2) the parameter determines time of full turn cycle of the slats. The parameter is irrelevant for other modes.</p&gt <p&gt0-65535 (0 - 655.35s, every 0.01s) - time of turn</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_153_1
parameter.label: 153: Set slats back to previous position
parameter.description: slats positioning in various situations<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtFor Venetian blinds (parameter 151 set to 2) the parameter determines slats positioning in various situations. The parameter is irrelevant for other modes.</p&gt <p&gt0 – slats return to previously set position only in case of the main controller operation</p&gt <p&gt1 – slats return to previously set position in case of the main controller operation, momentary switch operation, or when the limit switch is reached</p&gt <p&gt2 – slats return to previously set position in case of the main controller operation, momen-tary switch operation, when the limit switch is reached or after receiving the Switch Multilevel Stop control frame</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_154_2
parameter.label: 154: Delay motor stop after reaching end switch
parameter.description: time after which the motor will be stopped after contacts closed<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThe parameter determines the time after which the motor will be stopped after end switch contacts are closed.</p&gt <p&gt1-255 (0.1s - 25.5 seconds)</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_155_2
parameter.label: 155: Motor operation detection
parameter.description: Power threshold interpreted as reaching a limit switch.<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gt1-255 (1-255W) - report interval</p&gt <p&gt0 - no detection</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_156_4
parameter.label: 156: Time of up movement
parameter.description: time needed for roller blinds to reach the top<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter determines the time needed for roller blinds to reach the top. For modes with positioning value is set automatically during calibration, otherwise, it must be set manually.</p&gt <p&gt1-65535 (0.01 - 655.35 seconds)</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_157_4
parameter.label: 157: Time of down movement
parameter.description: time needed for roller blinds to reach the bottom<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter determines the time needed for roller blinds to reach the bottom.For modes with positioning value is set automatically during calibration, otherwise, it must be set manually.</p&gt <p&gt1-65535 (0.01 - 655.35 seconds)</p&gt</p&gt
